item.title: Egypt's ex-President Mohamed Morsi dies after court appearance
item.description: Egypt's first democratically elected president had suffered from neglect during his nearly six years of imprisonment.

item.title: Iran slams Saudi Arabia over tanker attack allegations
item.description: Tehran blames Riyadh's own 'misguided approach' for causing current tensions in the region.

item.title: Canada's Quebec bans religious symbols in some public sector jobs
item.description: Critics denounce 'politics of fear' as Quebec province bans some gov't employees from wearing religious symbols at work.

item.title: President Trump to seek second term in 2020 election
item.description: Trump enjoys 90 percent support in the Republican Party, a party he has remade in his own image.

item.title: Mohamed Morsi's death: World reaction
item.description: International reaction following the news of the death of the former Egyptian president.

item.title: Virginia Republicans lose in US Supreme Court gerrymandering case
item.description: Court leaves in place lower court ruling that invalidated 11 state House districts for racial discrimination.

item.title: Syria’s war: Children caught in ongoing violence
item.description: In the past six weeks, at least 400 civilians have been killed and a quarter of the victims were children.

item.title: New Quebec law stresses migrants' skills, thousands must reapply
item.description: Controversial bill that replaces first come first served standard will prompt shredding of 18,000 existing applications.

item.title: War crimes trial set for US Navy SEAL in ISIL prisoner's killing
item.description: Edward Gallagher has pleaded not guilty to premeditated murder in the stabbing death of a wounded ISIL prisoner.

item.title: US Supreme Court sends gay wedding cake case back to lower court
item.description: Action orders Oregon judges to reexamine dispute between lesbian couple and bakery owners who refused to make their cake

item.title: Uzbekistan reforms: Activists demand more changes
item.description: Most Uzbeks back president Mirziyoyev's reform process but they complain about difficulties such as finding jobs.

item.title: Paris Air Show: Plane safety, new fighter jets and 'flying taxis'
item.description: The world's biggest aerospace show will run in France's capital between June 17 and 23.

item.title: Algeria: The revolution will be YouTubed
item.description: Long before the protests began, a generation of YouTubers emerged as unofficial spokespeople for Algeria's youth.

item.title: Mali: Anger over G5 Sahel headquarters transfer to Bamako
item.description: The G5 Sahel force includes Burkina Faso, Chad, Mauritania, Niger as well as Mali, and people in Bamako do not want its headquarters based there.

item.title: China's President Xi to visit North Korea this week
item.description: North Korea's Kim Jong Un has visited China four times since March 2018 but it will be Xi's first trip to Pyongyang.

item.title: Ukraine's Mariupol stuck between war and Russian blockade
item.description: Mariupol is Ukraine's principal port on the Sea of Azov and has great economic and strategic significance.

item.title: Mali: Fighting ongoing between herders and farmers
item.description: What lies behind the ethnic violence that has killed dozens of people in one village alone in central Mali.

item.title: South Africa bus crash kills dozens of people
item.description: Four others sustained serious injuries when a taxi van and a bus collided in the town of Modjadjiskloof.

item.title: Iran to surpass uranium stockpile limits within days: AEOI
item.description: If levels of low-enriched uranium surpass a 300kg cap then Iran would violate the terms of the 2015 nuclear agreement.

item.title: Nigeria suicide attack: Triple blasts kill at least 30 in Borno
item.description: Three suicide bombers detonated explosives at Konduga village, 25km from Maiduguri, emergency services officials say.

item.title: Hong Kong protests: All the latest updates
item.description: Pro-democracy protest figure freed from jail as pressure on embattled leader Lam ratchets up over extradition bill.

item.title: Turkey coastguard: Eight dead after migrant boat sinks off coast
item.description: Turkish coastguard says 31 people were rescued, it is believed they were travelling to the Greek islands.

item.title: Hong Kong's lame duck? Leader Lam faces fight for political life
item.description: As calls for her resignation become louder, analysts say Carrie Lam pays the price for political miscalculations.

item.title: Israel names illegal Golan settlement after Trump
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu calls US president 'great friend' at inauguration ceremony in Golan Heights.

item.title: India reels under worst drought in decades, heat kills dozens
item.description: Western state of Maharashtra witnesses worst drought in 47 years, while intense heat kills dozens in impoverished Bihar.
